test_cases.objective: Verify that the receiving workflows are correctly configured for pharmaceutical materials with temperature monitoring and quarantine procedures.
prerequisites: WMS system is installed and configured
Test materials with temperature-sensitive attributes are available
User with receiving permissions is logged in

test_steps.action: Simulate receiving a temperature-sensitive pharmaceutical material
test_steps.expected_result: System captures temperature data and assigns quarantine location if excursion detected

test_steps.action: Verify chain of custody documentation is generated
test_steps.expected_result: Complete chain of custody document is created with all required fields

acceptance_criteria: Temperature excursion monitoring triggers quarantine workflow
Chain of custody documentation meets GDP requirements
Quality hold procedures are correctly initiated
data_integrity_requirements: All material movements must be recorded in audit trail
Temperature data must be stored with timestamp and user ID

test_cases.objective: Verify that serial number capture, verification, and hierarchy tracking are properly configured in the WMS.
prerequisites: Serialization module is configured and active
User with serialization permissions is logged in

test_steps.action: Scan a serialized product during receiving process
test_steps.expected_result: System captures and verifies serial number against master data

test_steps.action: Create parent-child relationship between serialized items
test_steps.expected_result: System correctly establishes and displays hierarchy relationship

acceptance_criteria: Serial numbers are captured and verified with 100% accuracy
Parent-child relationships are maintained through all processes
Exception handling for damaged units follows configured procedures
data_integrity_requirements: All serial number transactions must be recorded in audit trail
Hierarchy relationships must be preserved during aggregation/disaggregation

test_cases.test_name: Configured Receiving Workflow Verification with Temperature Excursion Handling
test_cases.objective: Verify that the receiving workflow is correctly configured to handle pharmaceutical materials with temperature excursion monitoring and quarantine assignment.
prerequisites: WMS system is installed and configured
Test materials with temperature-sensitive attributes are available
User credentials with receiving permissions are set up

test_steps.action: Simulate receiving a temperature-sensitive material with an excursion alert
test_steps.expected_result: System automatically assigns material to quarantine location and generates an excursion report

test_steps.action: Verify chain of custody documentation is generated
test_steps.expected_result: Complete chain of custody document is available with all required fields populated

acceptance_criteria: Material is correctly assigned to quarantine upon temperature excursion
All required documentation is generated automatically
data_integrity_requirements: All temperature data must be captured and stored with audit trail
Quarantine assignments must be traceable

test_cases.test_name: Serialization Management and Parent-Child Hierarchy Verification
test_cases.objective: Verify that the system correctly manages serialized products including parent-child hierarchy tracking and aggregation processes.
prerequisites: Serialization module is configured and active
User credentials with serialization permissions are set up

test_steps.action: Create a parent-child relationship between two serialized products
test_steps.expected_result: System correctly establishes and displays the hierarchical relationship

test_steps.action: Perform aggregation process for a case of serialized products
test_steps.expected_result: System correctly associates all serial numbers with the case identifier

acceptance_criteria: All hierarchical relationships are correctly maintained
Aggregation processes maintain complete traceability
data_integrity_requirements: All serial number relationships must be maintained with 100% accuracy
Aggregation data must be immutable once confirmed

test_cases.objective: Verify that the receiving workflows are correctly configured for pharmaceutical materials with temperature monitoring and quarantine procedures.
prerequisites: WMS system is installed and configured
Test materials with temperature-sensitive attributes are available

test_steps.action: Simulate receiving a temperature-sensitive pharmaceutical material into the WMS.
test_steps.expected_result: System captures temperature data and assigns the material to the correct quarantine location if temperature excursion is detected.

test_steps.action: Verify the quality hold procedures are triggered for materials with temperature excursions.
test_steps.expected_result: System places the material on quality hold and generates appropriate notifications.

acceptance_criteria: All receiving workflow steps are executed as configured
Temperature excursions are correctly identified and handled
Chain of custody documentation is complete and accurate
data_integrity_requirements: All data must be captured and stored without modification
Audit trail must record all actions

test_cases.objective: Verify that the serialization management features are correctly configured for track and trace compliance.
prerequisites: WMS system is installed and configured

test_steps.action: Simulate receiving a serialized pharmaceutical product into the WMS.
test_steps.expected_result: System captures and verifies the serial number and establishes parent-child hierarchy.

test_steps.action: Simulate a damaged unit scenario and verify exception handling.
test_steps.expected_result: System correctly processes the damaged unit and updates the serialization records accordingly.

acceptance_criteria: All serialization steps are executed as configured
Parent-child hierarchy is correctly maintained
Exception handling is performed according to procedures
data_integrity_requirements: All serialization data must be accurate and complete
Audit trail must record all serialization events

test_cases.objective: To verify that the receiving workflows are correctly configured for pharmaceutical materials, including temperature excursion monitoring, chain of custody documentation, quarantine location assignment, and quality hold procedures.

test_steps.action: Simulate receiving a pharmaceutical material with temperature excursion
test_steps.expected_result: System correctly identifies and logs the temperature excursion

test_steps.action: Simulate receiving a material requiring quarantine
test_steps.expected_result: System assigns the material to the correct quarantine location

test_steps.action: Simulate receiving a material with a quality hold
test_steps.expected_result: System correctly applies the quality hold procedure

acceptance_criteria: All receiving workflows are correctly configured and functional
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all logs are accurate and complete

test_cases.objective: To verify that the serialization management is correctly configured, including serial number capture and verification, parent-child hierarchy tracking, aggregation and disaggregation processes, and exception handling for damaged units.

test_steps.action: Simulate capturing a serial number
test_steps.expected_result: System correctly captures and verifies the serial number

test_steps.action: Simulate tracking a parent-child hierarchy
test_steps.expected_result: System correctly tracks the parent-child hierarchy

test_steps.action: Simulate aggregation and disaggregation processes
test_steps.expected_result: System correctly handles aggregation and disaggregation

test_steps.action: Simulate handling a damaged unit
test_steps.expected_result: System correctly handles the exception for the damaged unit

acceptance_criteria: All serialization management processes are correctly configured and functional
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all logs are accurate and complete

test_cases.objective: To ensure the system correctly handles temperature excursions during receiving workflows.
prerequisites: System is configured for receiving workflows

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature excursion during receiving of pharmaceutical materials.
test_steps.expected_result: System triggers temperature excursion handling procedures.

test_steps.action: Verify the quarantine location assignment for the affected materials.
test_steps.expected_result: Materials are assigned to the quarantine location.

acceptance_criteria: Temperature excursion handling procedures are triggered
Materials are correctly assigned to quarantine location
data_integrity_requirements: Accurate temperature excursion records
Correct quarantine location assignment

test_cases.objective: To verify the system correctly captures and verifies serial numbers during track and trace processes.
prerequisites: Track and trace processes are configured

test_steps.action: Scan a serialized unit during the receiving process.
test_steps.expected_result: System captures the serial number and verifies it against the serialization system.

test_steps.action: Simulate a damaged unit and verify the exception handling process.
test_steps.expected_result: System correctly handles the damaged unit and updates the serialization records.

acceptance_criteria: Serial numbers are correctly captured and verified
Exception handling for damaged units is correctly executed
data_integrity_requirements: Accurate serial number records
Correct exception handling records

test_cases.objective: To verify that the receiving workflows are correctly configured for pharmaceutical materials, including temperature excursion monitoring, chain of custody documentation, quarantine location assignment, and quality hold procedures.

test_steps.action: Simulate receiving a pharmaceutical material with temperature excursion.
test_steps.expected_result: System correctly captures and logs temperature excursion data.

test_steps.action: Simulate receiving a material requiring quarantine.
test_steps.expected_result: System assigns the material to the correct quarantine location.

test_steps.action: Simulate receiving a material with a quality hold.
test_steps.expected_result: System correctly applies quality hold procedures.

acceptance_criteria: All receiving workflows function as per URS-WMS-002
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all data captured is accurate and complete

test_cases.objective: To verify that the serialization management is correctly configured for track and trace, including serial number capture and verification, parent-child hierarchy tracking, aggregation and disaggregation processes, and exception handling for damaged units.

test_steps.action: Simulate capturing a serial number for a unit.
test_steps.expected_result: System correctly captures and verifies the serial number.

test_steps.action: Simulate creating a parent-child hierarchy.
test_steps.expected_result: System correctly tracks the parent-child hierarchy.

test_steps.action: Simulate aggregation and disaggregation processes.
test_steps.expected_result: System correctly handles aggregation and disaggregation.

test_steps.action: Simulate handling a damaged unit.
test_steps.expected_result: System correctly handles the exception for the damaged unit.

acceptance_criteria: All serialization management functions as per URS-WMS-005
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all serialization data is accurate and complete

test_cases.objective: To ensure the WMS correctly handles temperature excursions during receiving workflows.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature excursion during material receiving.
test_steps.expected_result: System triggers an alert and assigns materials to quarantine location.

test_steps.action: Review the audit trail for the temperature excursion event.
test_steps.expected_result: Audit trail records the excursion and subsequent actions accurately.

acceptance_criteria: Temperature excursion alert is triggered
Materials are assigned to quarantine
Audit trail is accurate
data_integrity_requirements: Audit trail must be complete and accurate

test_cases.objective: To verify the WMS correctly manages serialization processes including capture, verification, and exception handling.

test_steps.action: Capture serial numbers during receiving process.
test_steps.expected_result: System captures and verifies serial numbers accurately.

test_steps.action: Simulate a damaged unit during the serialization process.
test_steps.expected_result: System handles the exception and records the damaged unit correctly.

acceptance_criteria: Serial numbers are captured and verified
Exceptions are handled correctly
Records are accurate
data_integrity_requirements: Serialization records must be complete and accurate

test_cases.objective: To ensure the WMS is correctly configured to manage serialization processes, including serial number capture, parent-child hierarchy tracking, and exception handling.

test_steps.action: Scan a test serial number into the WMS.
test_steps.expected_result: Serial number is captured and verified by the system.

test_steps.action: Create a parent-child hierarchy for a set of serialized items.
test_steps.expected_result: Parent-child hierarchy is correctly tracked and displayed in the system.

test_steps.action: Simulate a damaged unit and initiate exception handling.
test_steps.expected_result: Exception handling process is triggered and documented correctly.

acceptance_criteria: Serial numbers are captured and verified accurately
Parent-child hierarchies are tracked correctly
Exception handling processes are documented
data_integrity_requirements: Serial number data must be accurate and complete
Exception handling documentation must be traceable

test_cases.objective: To verify the integration between the WMS and the temperature monitoring system for real-time temperature data capture and alerts.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature excursion in the monitoring system.
test_steps.expected_result: Temperature excursion alert is received by the WMS.

test_steps.action: Review the temperature data captured in the WMS.
test_steps.expected_result: Temperature data is accurately reflected in the WMS.

test_steps.action: Initiate a temperature excursion handling process in the WMS.
test_steps.expected_result: Handling process is documented and tracked correctly.

acceptance_criteria: Temperature excursions are detected and alerted in real-time
Temperature data is accurately captured in the WMS
Handling processes are documented and traceable
data_integrity_requirements: Temperature data must be accurate and complete
Handling documentation must be traceable

test_cases.objective: To ensure the receiving workflows are correctly configured for pharmaceutical materials, including temperature excursion monitoring, chain of custody documentation, quarantine location assignment, and quality hold procedures.

test_steps.action: Simulate receiving a pharmaceutical material with temperature excursion
test_steps.expected_result: System correctly identifies and logs the temperature excursion

test_steps.action: Assign a quarantine location to the received material
test_steps.expected_result: Material is correctly assigned to the quarantine location

test_steps.action: Initiate quality hold procedures
test_steps.expected_result: Quality hold procedures are correctly executed

All logs are accurately captured

test_cases.objective: To ensure the serialization management is correctly configured for track and trace, including serial number capture and verification, parent-child hierarchy tracking, aggregation and disaggregation processes, and exception handling for damaged units.

test_steps.action: Capture serial number of a unit
test_steps.expected_result: Serial number is correctly captured and verified

test_steps.action: Track parent-child hierarchy of a unit
test_steps.expected_result: Parent-child hierarchy is correctly tracked

test_steps.action: Perform aggregation and disaggregation processes
test_steps.expected_result: Aggregation and disaggregation processes are correctly executed

test_steps.action: Handle exception for a damaged unit
test_steps.expected_result: Exception handling is correctly executed

acceptance_criteria: All serialization management steps are correctly executed
All logs are accurately captured
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all logs are accurate and complete

test_cases.objective: Verify the configured integration between the WMS and ERP system for accurate material master data synchronization.

test_steps.action: Create a new material master record in the ERP system.
test_steps.expected_result: Material master record is successfully created in the ERP system.

test_steps.action: Verify the material master record in the WMS.
test_steps.expected_result: Material master record is synchronized and visible in the WMS within 5 minutes.

acceptance_criteria: Material master record is synchronized within 5 minutes
No data discrepancies between ERP and WMS
data_integrity_requirements: Data must be consistent between ERP and WMS
No data loss during synchronization

test_cases.objective: Validate the configured serialization management workflow for accurate serial number capture and verification.

test_steps.action: Scan a serialized unit during receiving process.
test_steps.expected_result: Serial number is captured and verified in the WMS.

test_steps.action: Verify the serial number in the serialization system.
test_steps.expected_result: Serial number is correctly recorded in the serialization system.

acceptance_criteria: Serial number is captured and verified in the WMS
Serial number is correctly recorded in the serialization system
data_integrity_requirements: Serial number data must be accurate and consistent
No data loss during serialization process
